snippet: Thwarted in their efforts to make the state's Presidential primary one of the earliest in the nation, California Democrats have devised a plan they hope will give the state a more prominent role in selecting party nominees.   Passed at the party's...
lead_paragraph: Thwarted in their efforts to make the state's Presidential primary one of the earliest in the nation, California Democrats have devised a plan they hope will give the state a more prominent role in selecting party nominees. Passed at the party's state convention last Sunday, the plan calls for nearly a third of the delegates to the Democratic National Convention to be selected at caucuses three months before the primary election in June.

headline.main: A California Plan for Early Caucuses

byline.original: By KATHERINE BISHOP, Special to The New York Times
